p: The challenge in introducing transgenic resistance to different banana cultivars lies in the sterility of the vegetatively propagated cultivars and the need to transform each cultivar separately, which is not a trivial task. On the other hand, as banana cultivars are essentially sterile, transgene flow to other cultivars or wild Musa species is unlikely. Since copy numbers and integration sites of transgenes are difficult to control, application of modern genome-editing technologies could allow targeting of specific host genes [ 66], for example, those playing a role in virus susceptibility, and achieving virus resistance.
